website_summaries.verdict: A great-looking and very lightweight option, although its size may leave you feeling cramped.
pros: Good-looking tent that comes in green or orange
cons: Tent is very small and not for the tall or claustrophobic
Aluminum stakes bend easily, making it difficult to use the tent on hard surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: The best feature of this tent was it's packed size. It fit really nicely in my backpack during a 3 day hike, and yet was big enough for me to sleep in. I'm about 5'10" and I have to say if I was any taller I'd be a little worried about space, but I was able to fit my 65 liter pack down by my feet at night, and my morning clothes and shoes up by my head. You certainly don't want to sit around in this tent for anything other than sleeping as it's pretty small, but it kept me dry and warm even through rain. Overall a good tent for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price and it cost to much to ship it back!
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of the tent is very thin and quality of it is not worth the price! I would return it but they are charging me to much just for the shipping to return it. Don't buy if your looking for good quality vs price because my cheap tent is much better and it like ten years old.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to be legit for a second. I slept in this tent for a military field exercise. The field exercise sucked. But you know what didn’t suck? Coming off shift to snuggle my tight ass into this slender little tent. Not only did the wind breaker open up nicely allowing optimal airflow. It was also literally two poles for set up. I woke up one morning and everything outside was soaked. Not this guy. Dry as something not wet. Tent was and is freaking amazing and easy to use. 10/10 would and will use again.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Cohem

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent
customer_reviews.text: Just right for my bug-out bag. I like the aluminum poles, as I don't have to worry about them breaking like fiberglass. Though I have not used it yet, I can tell it is well made and will be perfect for me and my pack. It weighs only 4 pounds, which isn't bad for what it is. I would recommend this for a bug-out bag or camping if moving a lot. It would be too small for a long-term base camp.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Thacker

customer_reviews.title: Good valve, light but claustrophobic. Not self supported
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from a 12 MC ride in morroco. I choose this tent as it was the lightest/price point. Materials looks good. Zippers work well. What didn't work for me is that it's not self supported. The tent needs to be pegged down for it to be upright. Second. I felt a but claustrophobic with the roof of tent right on top of my face. It got cold in the tent and there was moisture inside. Most importantly I couldn't sit up at the peak of the tent. I do some meditation before going to sleep and need to situp in a yoga posture. Will not use it again.
customer_reviews.author: CB_NYC

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for backpacking!
customer_reviews.text: The weight was fine for backpacking and the assembly was very obvious and easy. It seems to be of very good quality. The side entry makes it very easy to get in and out. I can sit up in it, but as others may have commented, it is not a tent you would use for anything else but sleeping. I bought a footprint that was the size of the tent, but regret not getting one that would extend out the door-side so that I could more easily get out and put on shoes, etc. I tried to buy another one but was disappointed when I saw that they were not available at that time.
customer_reviews.author: SJacobs

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: I’m a pretty big guy (5’ 11” 275lb) and was a little snug in the tent, but in a good way. For something to just throw up and sleep or to get out of the weather, it pretty much does that. I slept through some pretty strong winds and rain, but stayed pretty comfortable through out the night. One think I wish it came with is a little canopy or something when getting in. I could have put up a tarp or something with paracord, but I was just trying it out first. Other than that, the tear down was super fast and easy, along with setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: So I took it out for a trip to test some new gear, it held up well, but I found the setup,to,be a bit slow and annoying. You've gotta have somewhere you can put in stakes or it wont stand on its own. Its definitely a tight fit so expect a snug experience, not intolerable but snug and no room to sit upright. That said, it is pretty stleathy, low profile and fairly light weight. Overall I'd give it a "Meh" not great, not terrible... It'll do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great for long bike tour, minor drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: I took this tent on a 1,400 mile bike tour, and it worked well for me. For the price, you probably can't beat this tent for how lightweight and compact it is. However, it's important to note a few things: 1. This is not a free-standing tent. The stakes are necessary to give the tent its shape, so you may find it difficult to use this tent in places where the ground is hard or rocky. 2. I know it's obvious, but you really can't do anything inside the tent but lay down. 3. Condensation can drip onto the tent off the fly, if the fly isn't externally supported with the provided lines somehow.
customer_reviews.author: SaltySailor

customer_reviews.title: tall guy review
customer_reviews.text: If you are tall, this tent can work for you. Im six six. I can fit in it. I can be perfectly flat and be comfortable. Now dont get me wrong. it is a tight fit. but tall people have come to expect tight fits. this is a usable tent for tall people. no frills. you cant sit up. your knees touch the top when you bend them. but these are all things tall people have come to expect with small tents. I think this tent is good enough for tall people on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: matchu

customer_reviews.title: Be ginger with this tent.
customer_reviews.text: I've never pitched a tent before and I wanted to try it in my yard before taking it somewhere. I like the ease of setting up the tent. I like the over all design as well, it is a comfortable space to enter, lay down, and exit from. I think I tugged too hard when I staked the tent down because it tore at the seam. This was the first time I used the tent and I damnaged it. I'm unsure if I should send it back or buy a patch kit.
customer_reviews.author: kymmyc

customer_reviews.title: Overall would recommend, ONLY for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Very good Trent for what it is designed for. Lightweight, quick setup, and takes up very little room. Spent 10 days backpacking through CO and UT and I am pleased. However, a few negatives include a cheap bottom that could rip easily without a tarp and the lack of it's ability to become taut when fully staked in. It's already tiny to begin with so having the "ceiling" mesh drape down is a little frustrating. Went down to 20 degrees in Aspen at 11,000ft and this tent did a great job with heat conservation, as long as you have a decent sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Russell R

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to always pull tight
customer_reviews.text: If you don't get this tent pulled perfectly tight in every way, you'll spend the night in a saggy tiny tent that will almost be touching you. They do send you enough stakes and ropes, but depending on the ground you're on, it's definitely a challenge to pull the tent to it's maximum size.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vigor

customer_reviews.title: great quality for price
customer_reviews.text: i used this product straight out of the box on a 6 day hiking trip to Mt. Whitney. Im 5 foot 7 and had a good amount of room from head to toe. I wouldnt recommend if you are over 6 foot would be very snug. Its gets the job done if you are looking to save on space and only need it to sleep at nite . The good thing that it light and saves alot of room on your backpack
customer_reviews.author: sid de la torre

customer_reviews.title: In the zombie apocalypse, this would be useful!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in the event that society melts down and I have to live in the woods with my border collie. Needless to say, this bivy has not been necessary. However, I do not regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Good design, a bit small
customer_reviews.text: The tent holds up very well, and very well constructed. The problem is, I am 215 lbs and 6'1" and was a bit cramped inside of the tent. Praise to the design however, wind really has little effect in the tent, in the 60+ mph winds the other night, other tents around me were collapsing, this tent was not bothered at all. One small issue is the all mesh construction. The condensation collects on the top of the rainfly, the drips on you throughout the night.
customer_reviews.author: Max Johast

customer_reviews.title: Good but still not the most compact
customer_reviews.text: Good tent but i realy something even more compact for solo backpacking. This is still very very compact as you can tell from the 8x11 paper I’ve placed for comparison. However for packing light ever oz count so I’ve decided to go with the andake. It’s a bit harder to set up but still light.
customer_reviews.author: TheCabinCoder

customer_reviews.title: Nice 1 person tent, couples could easily fit too! No room dogs in addition though
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it because it wouldn't fit 2 people PLUS 2 dogs, just a bit too snug, but nice compact tent for a couple. Easy to set up and really not bad on space for 2. One person would have a very spacious tent. Cant really sit up, but overall not too bad, wish it was just a bit bigger for our needs!!
customer_reviews.author: Bernie and Fam

customer_reviews.title: I’d buy another.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality construction and materials. Used it twice so far. Packs small and is light weight. Only wish list for the manufacture to consider using Composite graphite polls instead of Aluminum. Because composite graphite polls are not likely to be accidentally bent out of shape.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonConsumer10000

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Used for an overnight back country camping trip just last night. There was a light sprinkle all night long and even after some waterproof spray some water did leak through the rain fly. The tent is large enough for me, a 5'7 145 pound female, but my friend who is a few inches taller than I (5'11) felt very cramped inside.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Guiles

customer_reviews.title: Color did not match what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: The green I ordered is not the color I received, and I was not able to use it because of the color. I ordered it for work (active duty army) because we were authorized (for once) to set up small tents/bivvys as long as they were far enough in the wood line and out of sight... Very disappointed that I won’t be able to use it. Put two pictures for comparison.
customer_reviews.author: tasha

customer_reviews.title: The tent is super easy to setup and fits easily into the provided ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time on a fly fishing trip in Northern Michigan. First night was in the mid 40's and in the morning there was a lot of condensation build up on underside of fly. Second night it rained most of the night, at times hard. The tent held up really well. I stayed completely dry. The tent is super easy to setup and fits easily into the provided stuff sack (including the poly tarp footprint I cut to size). Overall, I do like the tent. Will be testing it again on a two day backpack trip in northern Michigan in mid-October. Will provide an update after that trip
customer_reviews.author: Gibby67

customer_reviews.title: Rain Issues and Awkwardness
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, this tent is great looking and durable. However, it is just awkward to slip into and get comfortable in, and I could feel water droplets creep in when hit with heavy rain. I will continue to use it, but I would not recommend it for extended expeditions in risky weather environments.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight bivy/tent that doesn't break the bank
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I bought this for a bike packing trip and needed a tent that was lightweight and compact and also doesn't break the bank! I will test out how well this holds out in my trip scheduled in three weeks. Attached is a photo to show you how compact it is when stored. The pannier is on the left, and this bivy is in the middle. The one one the right is my compact 4-person tent that I usually bring with me.
customer_reviews.author: DaPillWurba

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and disassemble
customer_reviews.text: This tent is the best one I've bought so far. It's super lightweight and can be set up and taken down quickly and easily. It keeps water out well and stands up to the wind even on the windiest days. It could definitely use a vent other than the door as it gets pretty hot and muggy during the day, but otherwise does everything I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Flores

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tent
customer_reviews.text: Tent is super compact and lightweight. Took it on a geology field trip, nights were chilly so the smallness keeps you warmer. Only drawback, hard to change clothes inside, still would recommend for people who hike and have to carry supplies
customer_reviews.author: JMFM

customer_reviews.title: ... first camping trip in death valley and it rained pretty hard overnight
customer_reviews.text: Used it for my very first camping trip in death valley and it rained pretty hard overnight. SO glad i got this tent. Not one leak, stayed warm and dry. Super easy to set up too. Also really spacious inside, was able to fit a duffel bag and still had room. I'm physically fit, not chubby or skinny but can probably fit two people inside.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Extremely bright green
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used it once but I’m in the military and thought this would be better than the issued ones we get but the pictures don’t depict how bright green they really are. It’s blinding green. Other than that great tent
customer_reviews.author: Jesse key

customer_reviews.title: Not for gear laden people.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Never had it in the rain but when the temp dropped the inside condensed so bad it's not easy to be able to put it away dry. If you have gear to keep in the tent with you do not get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Yassss
customer_reviews.text: I used this tent in the rain at 35'F and it was fantastic. There's plenty of room to fuss around, and a nice clip to hang a headlamp from to light up the inside. But be sure to use a tarp or foot print underneath to protect from rocks, roots, and water!
customer_reviews.author: MC Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work as well as I would’ve liked...
customer_reviews.text: Took this tent on a camping tent. It was easy to setup and it is definitely lightweight. One of the issues I had was the tent poles didn’t seem to hold the tension required to keep the tent up completely. The tent canopy kept sagging giving me less room inside. Also the rain fly zipper broke on day 2. I liked the idea of this tent, but it didn’t work as well as I’d hope.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Erby

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price, I have used it on two trips and it works great. If you think you may encounter heavy rain I recommend draping a tarp over it.
customer_reviews.author: Brdawn

customer_reviews.title: Great ultralight bivy tent for star gazing!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first bivy tent purchased for my first ever 100 mile backpacking trip on the PCT. I was very pleased. It set up quickly. There was enough room in the tent to comfortably sleep and include my backpack and gear. The nosium netting worked great but what I REALLY loved was that I could unzip the rain cover and peel it back and have a great view of the stars at night!
customer_reviews.author: Kim R

customer_reviews.title: Love this little tent, perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first bivy and it is super light, easy to assemble only take 5-10 mins depending on your experience, kept me warm and it’s spacious enough for me I’m 5’0 and 103lbs, I fit in there just fine with my backpack and boots inside. One thing I never thought about though is the color choice I purchased the orange which I still love but didn’t take into account how much the bugs would be attracted it but not a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: Good little tent
customer_reviews.text: Small coffin tent, but great it you need to pack light and need protection from the wind, rain, and cold. I used this for camping in the Rockies and for other small camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: smees

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute essential for all my backpacking trips. First time I used this little beauty , got caught in a freak storm on the mountain, pummeled by rain, snow and rock hard hail, was snug as a bug! Used to carry a two person tent but never again. Granted not enough height to allow sitting but who wants to sit in a tent when outdoors anyway.
customer_reviews.author: azita

customer_reviews.title: Light but small
customer_reviews.text: It's light and easy to set up so it's great for backpacking, but it is small... I can't even sit up in it and I'm only 5' 6". So for the times when I car camp I'll stick with my larger tent. Would be nice to have another plastic latch where the cover unzips so it can be secured to a stake yet removed quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: tents for sleeping, cannot sit up, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: this tent is for sleeping only. im 6,2 and have another 6 inches left of room. it is shorter than I thought. you can not sit up in this tent. it is very easy to put up and breakdown. there was a light rain last night and no water went through. this tent must be staked down to not collapse. I rocky areas it may not work unless you replace the stakes with rope tied under a heavy rock. my only complaint is I wish it was about 8 inches taller to sit up.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: it was perfect for me and my backpack and boots
customer_reviews.text: Took this tent backpacking in the Tetons, it was perfect for me and my backpack and boots. I’m 6’6” and just to be clear, there was just enough room, and No extra.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lugosch

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely compact.it actually holds heat really well.and is deffinatly long enouph for me however it is very thin and a hook on it already broke off at the cloth(lucky i can sew)
customer_reviews.author: Koty williams

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Have to say this Bivy tent is super easy to setup, which is convenient in case you end up hiking until dark. It does have a low ceiling which is fine because the opening unzips wide enough to sit outside of the tent to roll up your sleeping bag. Lightweight poles and stakes. You can also make it a lot smaller then the case it comes in so that it wont take up too much of your pack. I dig it!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Carry
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for someone. He loves it and especially because it is lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Viking Lady

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Single Tent
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with this Tent Bivy. Took this out for a 5 day Back Pack trip in the Seven Devils Wilderness. I'm 6'1" 180 snug fit you don't want to be any larger worked great for me. Use a Space blanket tarp for your foot print fits just right. You wont need all the hard wear that it comes with so it can be lighter. Easy to set up and clean out. Side entry is the way go. You have to stake it at 4 points, it's not a self supporting standing tent.
customer_reviews.author: Troutdancer

customer_reviews.title: Good tent overall but not for taller buyers.
customer_reviews.text: Camping in Adirondacks 3 days. Good tent overall structurally and easy to put up. I’m 6’ 190 Lbs and it’s a little short for me. With a 1.5” sleeping pad under me my feet or head would touch in almost any angle I tried. If I laid straight both touched. I’d say if you’re over 5’9” you probably want something longer or taller at the ends at least.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little tent for 1 person
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tent for 1 person. I am in the Military and use it during field ops when I don't have to use the issued gear. I'm a big guy (6'4 230lbs) and I fit inside nicely. Could probably squeeze a second person in as well if you knew them really well. It holds up great against the wind and very easy to set up. One thing I would change is how much room there is to get in and out of it. It was a tight squeeze in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Giesen

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: Worked well in heavy duty trial. Resisted very high winds intact. Kept me dry when it counted. Would get five stars if it included heavier duty stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Buongiorno

customer_reviews.title: Kept me dry
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to set up, for a tall person, the fly is about 2 in. from your face.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Amazing 1-person tent that is easy to set-up and will keep you dry.
customer_reviews.text: Are you looking for a crossover between a bivy and a single person tent? If so, buy this tent. It is heavier than a bivy but lighter than a tent. It has held-up well for me in pretty rough conditions. I was backpacking in the high sierra and this little tent did well in snowy conditions. You won't be disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it- Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a two night camping trip and the tent worked perfectly. 2nd night had 1/2 hour of heavy rain and I was perfectly dry. The tent is small- I'm 5'10 and the fit was cozy. If you are over 6 foot, you may want a different tent. Easy set up, very light, and dry. Great tent.
customer_reviews.author: M&K

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Just had a chance to use this personal bivy. Easy set up, plenty of leg and body room for me (am 5'3"). I wanted to backpack as light as possible, so took it without the cover. Only took 4 stakes with me for set up and it held up great. Great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Chacon

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Light and compact. Well made and easy to set up. Only negative is it can get humid inside when using the rain fly. Could be better ventilated when closed up.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Roomy, light weight.
customer_reviews.text: Roomier than I expected. Inner tent falls down onto you--not an ideal situation.
customer_reviews.author: william cosby

customer_reviews.title: I do bike camping.
customer_reviews.text: works good. but I put down a used shower curtain to prevent water coming up from the bottom. Bottom of tent does not prevent water from coming in.
customer_reviews.author: francis zurawski

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Decent tent, but was disappointed that there was no structural integrity without using the fly. A nice night without rain, but was difficult to keep it up without the rainfly
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: No headroom was an adjustment
customer_reviews.text: I had to work around not being able to sit up at first but then just go accustomed to opening the tent and fly and strapping them open which allowed me to sit up. Then zip it all closed for nitey-nite. But low profile in the wind and light weight worked nicely. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Nice single person tent.
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once, but it worked just fine. But don't know about it's durability.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: This is great for hiking
customer_reviews.text: This is great for backpacking! Light weight and easy to set up
customer_reviews.author: Devin James

customer_reviews.title: I love it i used it in 20 degree weather (would ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it i used it in 20 degree weather (would not recommend) but its still a very spacious tent and well made
customer_reviews.author: Momofour

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Definitely 1 person, but you can cram 2 in there if you're trying. Solid build. The only reason I took a star away is because there tends to be a slight sag in the roof of the tent, but this can be fixed via adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used it yet, but feels like it’s good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gabor Laskai

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent! (So Far)
customer_reviews.text: Just got my tent today and I set it up in the backyard. It has been raining for the last 4 hours and I left the tent set up it’s still dry inside. Sturdy aluminum poles, nice tent stakes. I love it so far. Gonna sleep outside in it tonight to test it out. It will be raining as well so I’ll do an update tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Calem Heiser

customer_reviews.title: Light and quick to put up or take down
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to put up, very light weight, but cannot sit up straight as average (female) adult - makes it miserable if has to get out of harsh weather, cannot change or eat comfortably inside.
customer_reviews.author: cdr

customer_reviews.title: This tent is fantastic. Easy set up in minutes
customer_reviews.text: This tent is fantastic. Easy set up in minutes. The first night I used it in the field it poured buckets...I was wondering if I was going to wake up soaked. Not a single leak. Shed water like a duck's back. I highly recommend this tent for anyone planing on spending several nights outdoors. It dried quickly and was ready to go again that night. Best purchase I've made in years. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Janek

customer_reviews.title: still very good buy.
customer_reviews.text: I found the tent to be well made. I'm 6'4" and a bit cramped for space but still worked well. The weight with poles,ground fasteners.sndtent camp out to 3.3 lbs. still very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: mark s

customer_reviews.title: youre not going to get much better.
customer_reviews.text: what a deal!! for the price i doubt youre going to get much better than this. the best part is the rain fly goes all the way to the ground, so youre NOT getting wet. this is an awesome one person tent
customer_reviews.author: Dardenshouse

customer_reviews.title: maybe for a small person.
customer_reviews.text: Very small. if you're claustrophobic you're not going to want this tent. there is no room to store your gear inside.
customer_reviews.author: Aric K.

customer_reviews.title: Broken on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I received the tent and opened it right away to set up in my yard. As soon as I started setting it up I noticed a clip strap was broken. Having paid 100$ I expected something that would at least not arrive broken. It is still usable but I am disappointed. Other than that it seems like a great little tent.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent!
customer_reviews.text: Great little tent! Used it in Louisiana at a group camp and was very please. I'm a pretty small guy, 5'6" ~150lbs, and there was enough room for myself, my pack, and a little bit of gear. Only negative (and that seems too harsh a word) is the stakes seem to bend a little easily, but it's a very acceptable trade off considering how lightweight they are.
customer_reviews.author: J Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Light and easily packs into hiking bag
customer_reviews.text: Light and easily packs into hiking bag. Did well in the all night rain without any issues. No problems with condensation. Plenty of room for single sleeper and gear.
customer_reviews.author: Brett H.

customer_reviews.title: Campers must own.
customer_reviews.text: A really good field tent. Has saved my life in freezing temperatures in hohenfels Germany during field exercises. Winter proof layer of course is thin but pretty tough. Very compact, able to put into a 72hr bag with survival emergency equipment. Big enough for two normal sized people.
customer_reviews.author: Davon Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Hiking/backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is so very quick and easy to set up. It is comfortable, easy to break down and lite weight.
customer_reviews.author: Rochalle Rooks

customer_reviews.title: Cute little tent well designed
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and light weight. Material is good! Spacious inside
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: Setups up pretty easy and fast I just don’t like how I can sit up to change without opening the whole door which I don’t like
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Weighs 3.2lbs
customer_reviews.text: Its a good tent but it weighs 3.2lbs. I was expecting it would weigh 2lbs as in de product description. I will have to return. Otherwise if you are ok with the weight of it, its roomy, and a good product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Goia

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great little tent for the price. Its light and durable and keeps you warm and dry. What else could you ask for.
customer_reviews.author: August

customer_reviews.title: Great during the summer
customer_reviews.text: Great during the summer, acts as an awesome bug net. Went camping in light snow, the tarp did its job, but in the middle of the night there was a little to much condensation. I am unsure yet if the tarp will hold up in rain or prolonged exposure to snow during warmer winter months.
customer_reviews.author: ethen

customer_reviews.title: Not terribly durable, but great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent for two weeks in while backpacking in Norway and Iceland. It kept me warm and dry in all sorts of poor weather. While it is smaller, it is extremely light and easy to carry. It's shorter but this design worked well for me when I camped in high winds in Iceland. Knocked off a star because one of the seams ripped during said windstorm. It's not terribly durable, but great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Decent for backpacking. Not for comfort.
customer_reviews.text: Not tall enough. You can't sit up in this tent.
customer_reviews.author: jpb

customer_reviews.title: good rain protection
customer_reviews.text: lite weight, good rain protection. A bit small. I am 5' 7" and my toes would hit the tent while lying flat, no matter how I moved positions. The head space was acceptable though the tent did get quite warm quickly (not a place to go for shade and definitely more of a winter tent). I could place an acceptable amount of stuff above my head and on the sides, but definitely not the whole pack.
customer_reviews.author: R. M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Just completed 4 days on Mt Hood’s Timberline trail. This was incredibly easy to setup, lightweight and very comfortable to sleep in. I’m 6’ and weigh 230 but had plenty of room. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R. Sturgis

customer_reviews.title: No place for condensation to go
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a backpacking trip to the Wallowa's in Oregon. It never rained but it got down to the high-30s to low 40s at night. The major problem was that there was nowhere for the condensation inside the tent to go (no vents), so the inside of the tent was drenched in the morning even though there was not a cloud in the sky all night and very little dew on the ground. In other words, if you are buying a tent to stay dry (which I think is the purpose) this tent is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Pack Tent!
customer_reviews.text: I hiked this little tent into the Grand Canyon. Easy to carry, easy to set up. The only issues with this tent have to do with I am getting older and have a belly. Getting in and out requires a little effort and so does getting dressed... lol. The tent is great, I need some improvement!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Follett

customer_reviews.title: Its stays strong
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried it out in the desert yet but I'm really looking forward to using it. It was easy to set up. There was a lot of strong winds and it heald up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Fambalam

customer_reviews.title: Even keeps out the no-seeums
customer_reviews.text: Product is easy.to set up and works well as intended ..though I haven't attached the rain fly yet
customer_reviews.author: Ray Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Great Value For The Price. It's lightweight and compact. Perfect for backpacking adventures. Easy to assemble even a child can do it, you do not even need the instructions. Recommend it 100%!!
customer_reviews.author: Samo Boro

customer_reviews.title: Put a small tarp on the ground before you set your tent
customer_reviews.text: Backpacking and hiking Very easy to carry in the backpack very quick and easy to set up and take down Love it
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Whetsell

customer_reviews.title: Ideal solo tent
customer_reviews.text: This is the idea solo tent. It is light weight and prefect for my backcountry hiking / fishing trips. The door opens the length of the tent to allow easy entry and exit. The price point is a real positive.
customer_reviews.author: David R Cook

customer_reviews.title: Space-minded
customer_reviews.text: Slightly smaller than I expected. I never realized how nice it is to be able to have enough room to change clothes in a tent until I bought this tent and couldn't sit up in it. Super lightweight and convenient to set up and take down!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Legut

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and bigger than it appears. Though heavier than 2.9 lbs as advertised, closer to 5lbs.
customer_reviews.author: mparisi

customer_reviews.title: Split pole
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the bag one of the poles are split
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Seegmiller

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love how compact it is, I use it whenever I go to the field in the summer time.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Rose

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Havent used it yet but its light and looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the size-challenged camper, works well, and is very compact.
customer_reviews.author: PJM

customer_reviews.title: So easy
customer_reviews.text: Easy and fast to set up. Not something I'd recommend if you're taller than 5'10"
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: It's not the most compact one person tent once it's folded into the bag but it's very light
customer_reviews.text: It's what I expected. Exclusively for sleeping, that's it. and it's great. Forget about doing anything else like changing clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super light, easy, comfortable tent
customer_reviews.text: This weekend I went on my first backpacking trip with the Winterial tent. It's easy to carry and simple to set up. It was cool during the warm part of the night with the rain fly door rolled back and warm when the temperature dipped and I closed the flap. I was totally pleased with the tent, but I don't know how it will perform in the rain, since the weather was clear. I can't sit up inside, but it's easy to get in and out of the tent. There was plenty of room for me (5'6") and all of my gear. I left my shoes under the rain fly right outside my door.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Holtry

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was a great tent for bikepacking on the CO trail. It's lightweight, easy to assemble and seems high quality. I'd highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew May

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than expected , material is all right, haven't tested the tent yet
customer_reviews.author: gunman

customer_reviews.title: It is great. Can't sit up in it but it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Spent a whole summer living in this bivy. It is great. Can't sit up in it but it is spacious on the inside!
customer_reviews.author: Tana Clark

customer_reviews.title: Soft ground or no good!
customer_reviews.text: Note you must be able to stake into the ground or the tent is NOT able to stand up.
customer_reviews.author: Beth-Ann

product_meta.title: Winterial Single Person Personal Bivy Tent, 1 Person Tent Lightweight 2 Pounds 9 Ounces, Green
feature_bullets: EASY ASSEMBLY: Single Person Tent with Two Hoop Easy To Assemble Bivy Tent
PERFECT FOR HIKING AND BACKPACKING: Bivy Tent Sleeps One Person take it with you on any trip
3 SEASON TENT: Ventilated Roof Mesh With a Full Coverage Rain Fly for Colder/Rainy Weather
LIGHT WEIGHT: Packed weight: 3 pounds 3 ounces. Packed Size: 18" x 4.5" x 4" Open Dimensions: 38 x 28 x90 inches.
ACCESS: Large Zippered door for easy access. Includes 3 bundles of rope and 14 Heavy Duty Stakes To Firmly Secure
